He is told to have the taxes go accompanied by a document recording the names, patronymics, tribes and towns of the tax-payers. msItemStruct.note: The reference list mentions: Large Arabic Document; but we there are two papyri under this number (5558(1) and 5558(2)). Edition's Side A is Recto; Side B Verso according to APIS guidelines.

condition.ab: Light brown papyrus. Written in black ink perpendicular to the papyrus fibers on side A, parallel to the fibers on side B. The papyrus is complete on all four sides and the original cutting lines have been preserved on the bottom, top, and partially on the left and right sides. There are several small holes in the papyrus.
